result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Ricardo Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin Ricardo Mendoza in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Martin Ricardo Mendoza in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case 10:54 AM - makes stmt.  State makes recommendation - 8 yrs prison - 4 yrs in and 4 yrs ES credit for 406 days time served - absolute sobriety - obtain employment.  Atty Petros makes arguement requests probation recommendations be followed.   DE addressed the Court.  Court addressed the defendant.  DE makes further stmt.

Court:  Sentenced to 8 years prison - 4 yrs incarcerated credit for 406 days time served  - 4 years extended supervision - costs - absolute sobriety - Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription - Complete Cognitive Behavioral Programmiing, such as CGIP, T4C, or another approved program.
Complete an AODA assessment and any follow through treatment/counseling - -obtain GED or full-time employment - eligible for challenge and substance abuse programs -
Sentencing hearing on October 31, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Martin Ricardo Mendoza in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Petros waives pre-lim.  Court advised the DE as to his right to prelim.  DE does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Defendant Acknowledges receipt of information. 
Parties have agreement. State requesting PSI.  Def pleads guilty through Atty Petros.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Court finds Def has entered plea freely, intelligently and voluntarily. Def finds Def waives rights freely, intelligently and voluntarily. Plea questionaire filed.

Court finds Def guilty. Court orders long form PSI. Sentencing Hearing shceduled for October 16, 2017 at 2:30 PM
